intro: Readea membranacea, commonly known as the membrane leaf plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and is characterized by its thin, membranous leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the warmer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
